sentence.idiomatic: The boss looks very happy today.
This job seems very tough to do.
How's Ms. Li doing? She looks much better.
You look upset. What's wrong?
What's wrong with Ms. Wang? She is not feeling well.
What's up? My boss refused to give me a raise, because I haven't been with the company for long.
My boss told me that he would give me a raise.
Whom did you speak to about this? I spoke to Mr. Wang.
Mr. Li didn't tell me he had been to Hong Kong.
Ms. Wang's performance this month is very good.
How is Mr. Li's performance this year? All right.
You can only ask for a raise if your performance is very good.
I asked my boss for a raise last month, because my salary is too low.
When was the last time you got a raise? Last year.
Has your boss agreed to give you a raise? Yes. How much? Five percent.
Although Ms. Li is very beautiful, but she isn't very smart.
Although I've got more money, but I still can't afford an apartment.
Although this TV set is a little bit expensive, but the quality is great.
You look upset. What's up?
I told my boss that my performance is good. I should be given a raise.
He doesn't agree?
He says that although my performance is good, but I haven't been with the company for long.
